Questions.Question: Who said, 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do'?
Questions.Explanation: Steve Jobs, the co-founder of Apple Inc., emphasized the importance of passion in achieving success.

Questions.Question: Which famous figure said, 'In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity'?
Questions.Explanation: Albert Einstein, the renowned physicist, believed that challenges present chances for growth and progress.

Questions.Question: Who said, 'Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts'?
Questions.Explanation: Winston Churchill, the British Prime Minister, highlighted the importance of resilience and perseverance.

Questions.Question: Which famous figure said, 'The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams'?
Questions.Explanation: Eleanor Roosevelt, the former First Lady of the United States, emphasized the power of dreams and belief.

Questions.Question: Who said, 'It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop'?
Questions.Explanation: Confucius, the Chinese philosopher, emphasized the importance of perseverance and continuous effort.
